roleset.name: to shock or surprise
roleset.note: STUN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'stun' based on WSJ; adjectival 'stunned' based on BOLT-2,3. (from stun.01-v)
STUNNING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from stunning.01-j)
STUNNED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from stunned.01-j)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The decision [*] to put the entire collection on the block stunned many , since Mr. Dorrance had served as chairman of the Philadelphia Museum of Art , and it [*EXP*-3]had been assumed [*-1] [0] many of the works would be donated [*-2] to the institution .
example.arg: The decision [*] to put the entire collection on the block
since Mr. Dorrance had served as chairman of the Philadelphia Museum of Art , and it [*EXP*-3] had been assumed [*-1][0] many of the works would be donated [*-2] to the institution

example.name: all arguments
example.text: In July , the company stunned Wall Street with the prediction that growth in the personal computer business overall would be only 10 % [*ICH*-1] in 1990 , a modest increase when [*]compared [*-2] with the sizzling expansion of years past [*T*-3] .
example.arg: with the prediction that growth in the personal computer business overall would be only 10 % [*ICH*-1] in 1990 , a modest increase when [*]compared [*-2] with the sizzling expansion of years past [*T*-3]

example.name: adjectival rel: stunned
example.text: I 'm still stunned because I figured AZ would be way more likely to go for Santorum a little strongly compared to MI .
example.arg: because I figured AZ would be way more likely to go for Santorum a little strongly compared to MI
